```{r cars}
transformation=function(x){
  cube=x^3
  sqr=x^2
  sqrt=x^0.5
  log=log(x)
  reciprocal_sqrt=1/sqrt
  inverse=1/x
  reciprocal_sqr=1/sqr
  reciprocal_cube=1/cube
return(list(x=x,sqr=sqr,cube=cube,sqrt=sqrt,log=log,reciprocal_sqrt=reciprocal_sqrt,inverse=inverse,reciprocal_sqr=reciprocal_sqr,reciprocal_cube=reciprocal_cube ))
}
x=rnorm(300,mean = 20,sd=4)  # generating sample data set
transformed_values<-transformation(x)
#transformed_values
par(mar = c(4.8, 2.2, 1.2, 0)) #to arrange margin size around the plots
par(mfrow=c(3,3))  #to put the plot in 3 rows and 3 columns.
 #codes to draw histogram from original and transformed values.
hist(transformed_values$x,main = "Histogram of X",col="skyblue",border="darkblue",xlab="x",ylab="Frequency",density = 40)
hist(transformed_values$cube,main = "Histogram of (X^3)",col="blue",border="red",xlab = "X cube",ylab = "Frequency",density = 40)
hist(transformed_values$sqr,main = "Histogram of sqr of X",col="skyblue",border="darkblue",xlab="X sqr",ylab = "Frequency",density = 40)
hist(transformed_values$log,main = "Histogram of log of X",col="blue",border="red",xlab = "Log x",ylab = "Frequency",density = 40)
hist(transformed_values$sqrt,main = "Histogram of sqrt of X",col="skyblue",border="darkblue",xlab = "Sqrt of x",ylab = "Frequency",density = 40)
hist(transformed_values$reciprocal_sqrt,main = "Histogram of 1/sqrt(X)",col="blue",border="red",xlab = "1/sqrt(x)",ylab = "Frequency",density = 40)
hist(transformed_values$reciprocal_sqr,main ="Histogram of 1/sqr(X)",col="skyblue" ,border="darkblue",xlab = "1/sqr(x)",ylab = "Frequency",density = 40)
hist(transformed_values$reciprocal_cube,main ="Histogram of 1/(X^3)",col="blue",border="red",xlab = "1/(x^3)",ylab = "Frequency" ,density = 40)
hist(transformed_values$inverse,main ="Histogram of 1/X" ,col="skyblue",border="darkblue",xlab = "1/X",ylab = "Frequency",density = 40)


```
